availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Junot (Louisville, KY, watchman and policeman, capt Co A Frankfort Battalion USA)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, watchman, policeman, and soldier. Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, native. Son of Joseph Junot. Married to Agnes C. Junot. Father of James N. Junot, Emmaline L. Junot, and William Junot. Watchman in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Policeman in Louisville in 1861. Organized and served in the Frankfort Battalion of Kentucky Volunteers (U.S.A.) as captain from February 24, 1865, to March 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 6th Ward, p.282.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, Ward 2, District 5, p. 96A.
"Capt. Junot's Last Days," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), March 22, 1890, p. 9.
“Death of 'Capt.' Junot,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), April 24, 1890, p. 8.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 822.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 135.
KYR-0003-101-0013.
